channel.title: Impact on James Ransom
channel.description: Recent content in Impact on James Ransom

item.title: Recovery can be achieved through empowering our regions – including England’s south east
item.description: Article for Science & Engineering South on regional collaborations between universities, colleges, healthcare, communities and business.

item.title: An arms race towards local irrelevance
item.description: Current approaches to local engagement are impeded by outdated strategic planning models.

item.title: New research on university partnerships for Universities UK
item.description: Exploring the potential impact of university partnerships over the next five years.

item.title: Universities and the UK’s economic recovery: an analysis of future impact
item.description: This report looks ahead at the predicted impact of UK universities over the next five years. It formed the centrepiece of Universities UK’s GettingResults campaign.

item.title: Universities can drive economic recovery if everyone plays their part
item.description: In an article for Wonkhe, I set out what it will take for universities to play the fullest possible role in bouncing back post-pandemic.

item.title: Size Matters: Completing the Jigsaw for Rural and Regional Productivity
item.description: Article co-authored with Matthew Guest, published in the Journal of Applied Business and Economics.

item.title: How to write an engagement strategy
item.description: In this article for Wonkhe, I ask what university strategies and a psychology experiment from the 1940s have in common.
